I would bet they are actually pretty careful with what they do and I'm sure 
there actors are also very careful within the limits. Just because you sign 
a waiver doesn't mean shit. Doesn't indemnify them if they actually hurt 
someone. If someone got sexually assaulted or severely injured the owner of 
the attraction could be facing a serious lawsuit and the actor quite 
possibly criminal charges. Waivers only work should you get injured in the 
capacity of what is expected. If sexual assault is not to be expected on a 
haunted house and you get groped, they could find their business in a world 
of hurt. Things like this really are a grey area and the right judge might 
send down a very harsh sentence if something beyond expectation occured.

comments.text:
+Oliver Tudor Don't go in a haunted house if you don't want to be "cruely 
and unfairly tortured". If they are physically beating the life out of your 
lungs, file a lawsuit and get out at the next exit. You have the option to 
do that. That is if you read the waver. People AGREE to do these things 
with the rule that there must be no retaliation. Even the owner advises 
people not to do it because him and his employees are being controlled by 
other people from Vegas. People's experiences are live-streamed and people 
make bets on how long they'll last before they crack. That's how they make 
their money since the dog food and proceeds go to a charitable 
organisation. Those people running the live-stream relay directions to the 
employees on what they want done to these people. Have you ever seen the 
"Stone Cold" Steve Austin movie The Condemned? That's practically what this 
is minus the murdering. So if you go in and get charged with aggravated 
assault, are you really a better more mature person because something 
didn't go your way? You'll have violated the waver. When you kids grow up 
you'll learn violence doesn't solve everything. Maybe little disputes on 
the playground with fatties, but that shit doesn't fly in the adult world. 
The point is though, this guy is full of bullshit. If this story was true 
then he would of had charges pressed against him. Plus people who go in are 
usually blindfolded. If you sign up after all the bad publicity this has 
gotten, it is your fault. Simply do NOT got in. What next, are you going to 
believe he's really the 7000th Zombie Slayer?

meh sounds like a cake walk compared to the park near my house. basically 
they do something called Woodland madness which they do every halloween. i 
went 2 years ago... never going again. and i dont scare easy. basically 
what did it for me was stepping into a rope trap, getting my leg stuck in a 
rope, hearing an engine start and then flying by my leg up a tree at 60mph. 
woke up the next day with a dislocated leg and a broken finger. was fucking 
painful, but apparently i got off light. my friend broke both his arms and 
he was saying that some kind of monster that was on fire chased him through 
most the park before he fell off a ledge with his hands in front of him. 
now the thing that is creepy is that its not advertised on the internet as 
its a local thing, except the people who do it aren't local. they gave me a 
card which said "horror fest" on it and the building being 666 satanic 
lane... looked that place up too and its safe to say its not in the UK. 
when i explained to them that one of my friends saw a giant thing on fire 
chasing him, all they said is "We dont know of any giant fiery things 
walking around as all we do is set up little traps which we caught you 
with. all we do for chasing people is dress up but some of the actors have 
gone missing after seeing a fiery giant chasing them"... fuck knows whether 
its them or not. but this year im thinking of going down there, chatting to 
the people, seeing what they know then walking through and finding the 
thing. if its them then i'll just let them know how awesome it is, if not 
then im going to trip the thing up and hope it isnt a real demon... if it 
is then im fucked.﻿
